Here you can find an overview of the schedule, as well as a more detailed programme below.

Overview

Monday

We will meet in room 129 on the first floor of SISSA for the talks.

  • 8:50: Welcome
  • 9:00 - 9:45 Giuliano Iurilli: The representation of odors and sampling behavior in the brain cortex
  • 9:45 - 10:30 Francesca Mastrogiuseppe: Quality of the internal representation shapes learning performance in recurrent neural networks
  • 10:35 - 11:00 Coffee break
  • 11:00 - 11:45 Michele Allegra: Approaches to brain controllability
  • 11:45 - 12:15: Jon Carr: Minimizing uncertainty in visual word recognition: A Bayesian model and experiments with artificial languages
  • 12:15 - 14:00 Lunch break
  • 14:00 - 14:30: Iacopo Hachen: Dynamics of history-dependent perceptual judgement
  • 14:30 - 15:00: Francesca Schönsberg: The breaking point of the continuous quasi-attractor model for spatial memories
  • 15:00 - 16:00: Discussion
  • 16:00 - 16:30: Coffee break

Tuesday

We will meet in room 129 on the first floor of SISSA for the talks.

  • 9:00 - 9:45 Kishore Kuchibhotla: Revealing latent knowledge in cortical networks during goal-directed learning
  • 9:45 - 10:30 Clélia de Mulatier: TBC

  • 11:00 - 12:30 Discussion period
  • 14:00 - 14:45 Nicolas Brunel: From fixed point attractors to sequential activity in recurrent neural networks

  • 16:30 Hike
  • 19:30 Conference dinner

Wednesday

We will meet in room 4 on the ground floor of SISSA for the talks.

  • 9:00 - 9:45 Tatyana Sharpee: TBC.
  • 9:45 - 10:30 Alessandro Ingrosso: Data-driven emergence of convolutional structure in neural networks
  • 10:35 - 11:00 Coffee break
  • 11:00 - 11:30: Paolo Muratore (contributed): Prune and distill: similar reformatting of image information along rat visual cortex and deep neural networks
  • 11:30 - 12:15: Fabio Anselmi: A Fourier analysis of neural networks preferred features for recognition
  • 12:15 - 12:30: Wrap-up and good-bye
